p: Acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) is an acute respiratory failure syndrome caused by extrapulmonary and intrapulmonary serious diseases. The lesions are basically diffusive damages to pulmonary capillaries with increased permeability. The pathological changes mainly include pulmonary emphysema, formation of hyaline membrane, and pulmonary atelectasis. And clinically it is characterized by progressive respiratory distress and intractable hypoxemia, which are typical manifestations of acute pulmonary lesions in the advanced stage.
